title: For Sale/Trade:  Insight M6 Light/Laser with LED upgrade kit
postcontent:
I have up for sale and Insight M6 that has been upgraded from incandescent to LED this made the light much brighter and upped the battery life considerably. The light alone will run you almost $300 anywhere else and the LED kit is another $70 I've also got box and papers. So im selling this at a huge discount the only reason im selling is I had this on a Glock switched to a Sig 1911 and the trigger guard sticks out a little to far to let the light fully lock onto the Sig its worked great on Berettas, Sig P229, XD, M&P, and it fit great on my Kimber as well.

The only problem with this light is the black plastic cover came off the mode selector and I cant find it. This does not affect the functionality of the light at all it just makes it a little harder to twist the selector that controls whether the light only, laser only or both comes on when you turn the light on.

title: For Sale:  AK47 Single Stack (WASR-10) .762 x 39w/ Extras
postcontent:
I have a gently used single-stack Romanian WASR-10.

I bought the gun new in the grease pouch.  I has maybe 300 rounds through it.  Te gun is very accurate, fun to shoot, and cheap to shoot.  It's chambered in .762x39.  Single stack AK's aren't super popular nowadays, but they shoot the same as their heavily ammo laden counterparts.  These guns are becoming increasingly hard to find.  They are also easily modified to accept hi-cap mags if you so desire, I just never got around to it.

"The WASR-10 is a post-ban version of the AKM rifle in 7.62x39mm caliber. Factory-original rifles only support single-stack, low-capacity magazines (ten rounds), but are frequently modified by Century Arms to accept double-stack, regular-capacity magazines (thirty rounds or more). Pistol grip and thumbhole stocks are both commonly found." - Wikipedia

The gun comes with an NcStar scope, aftermarket receiver cover with integrated picatinny rail, black dragunov-style fiber stock with built-in cheek rest, original OD Green sling, 1x 10rnd mag, 1x 5rnd mag, original cleaning kit, and original stock and hand grip.  

I'm really looking to trade for a nice bull barrel .17 HMR setup.  (I'd prefer Savage)  I will accept cash if the offer is good enough.  I will throw in all the .762 ammo I have.  (not sure how much right now, so don't plan on a lot)  Shoot me some offers and we'll talk.

Bill of sale required.  I will want to see Indiana DL and, although it's not required, a copy of your CCW permit.   (just to be safe)

title: For Sale:  Attic find; Old box full of misc muzzle loading and vintage shot shell reloading equipment circa early 1800's to late 1800's
postcontent: Found in an attic a large wooden box, which appears to be hand made with two black powder muzzel loader powder flasks; one leather covered with a double lever brass dispensing/measuring valve on top and the other a larger size copper bodied flask with a single dispensing brass valve on top and a leather cord shoulder strap fastend to it along with a embosed scene of two hunting dogs in persuit of a quarrie, there seems to be material still in both of these flasks, p[osibly black powder ?  There are also three extra brass dispensing valves that would be for powder flasks also. Also is an assortment of what appear to be early shot shell paper cartridge reloading tools and equipment; wad cutters, crimping tools, of which the newest looking is marked Pat. Sept. 1891, an assortment of powder measurers and what appear to be powder/shot compacting tools ? some what appear to be primer presses ? I do not reload and am sure this stuff is much older than I am ? ( I am a grandfather by the way) so this stuff is all quite dated, With my limited knowledge of loading/reloading I am am speculating on a lot of this. Also several brass containers of UMC #2 and #5 primers and more assortted tools and equipment. Some of this stuff was also inside an old wooden cigar box labeled Okoporto Conchas with a label attached that reads Meyers, Tice & Co. Dubuque, Iowa and the tax stamp on the cigar box is dated  Feb. 30, 1892 which may help date some of the contents. Also a hinged wooden box with a bunch of holes in it that were partially occupied by a bunch of what looks like hand cut round paper/cardboard wads, the box appears to be some sort of commercially made product ? There is alo some other old misc. stuff in this box.There was also several pages of the Minneapolis Star newspaper dated October 1950 used as a box liner on the bottom of the box which to me would probably indicate when all this stuff was packed away and put in the attic. Sorry I do not have any pictures or a method to take any to post and if you are still reading this ad then this "stuff" is still available. If seriously interested please include a phone contact number in your first reponse or Due to all the spam out there I will not be able to answer your inquirey.  ? Thanks.

title: For Sale:  UNFIRED Sako TRG-S   30-378 Weatherby Magnum
postcontent:
UNFIRED Sako TRG-S (M995 Super Mag) in caliber 30-378 Weatherby Magnum.  Includes original factory box and 1 box of 20 Weatherby shells.  These guns are highly accurate and are impossible to find in unfired condition.  $1900 Firm

Info on the rifle:      

SAKO TRG-S is based on a TRG sharpshooting system.  This is a bolt action hunting rifle with a detachable clip magazine. The receiver is made by cold hammering method. The action is designated: Long action M995 and it is made for calibers 30-378 Weatherby and 338 Lapua Magnum. The magazine is detachable, reliable centre fed box magazine.
The single-stage trigger pull is adjustable from 1 kg to 2 kg (2 to 4 lbs). All models are available with a single-set trigger as option. The design of the stock and pistol grip makes the rifle suitable for both left and right handed shooters. Due to the straight stock, the recoil comes evenly backwards, therefore giving easy recoil control even under difficult hunting situation. The stock is made of polyurethane, reinforced with a rigid injection moulded skeleton.
The buttplate is the same as on the TRG shooting system. The stock length and heelplate angle can be easily adjusted with straight or angled spacers. Integral rails for the scope mounts are on the top of the receiver.
The totally free-floating barrel is cold-hammer forged.  The Sako TRG-S is perfect rifle for hunters looking for synthetic large-action performance. The extremely accurate rifle is based on the world renowned TRG-design and technology. Massive bolt with three symmetrical locking lugs and short 60° lift. Detachable magazine that feeds straight into the chamber. Black, high-tech composite stock with integrated reinforced skeleton for increased rigidity and accuracy. Available calibers are 30-378 Wby Mag and 338 Lapua Mag.

TECHNICAL DATA

Caliber: 30-378 Wby Mag	Rate of twist: 11" 
Cartridge capacity: M995 Super Mag 3-round detachable magazine

Barrel length: 26"
Weight: 8 1/8 lbs

title: For Sale:  Chiappa Rhino 50DS - Hard Chrome - 5"
postcontent:
I've had my fun. It's time to share. This Rhino makes 357 feel like 9mm. It is amazing. This one has the new light trigger. Great in double or single action. This is definitely a bullseye gun.

I haven't shot this gun much. I would guess 100 rounds total and 88 of those were 38 special. It is in perfect condition. It's only a couple months old and it has been in the safe that whole time.

$925 cash face to face would be great or we can trade.  I'm looking for:

9mm 1911, 9mm Sig p226 or p229 Stainless Elite, 9mm STI, 9mm Race Gun, Glock 34 together with some other interesting gun from your collection.

Description from the Chiappa website:

The new Chiappa Rhino has revolutionized the revolver with a patented design that tames the prehistoric caracteristic that most revolvers possess. The new Chiappa Rhino barrel is aligned with the bottom most chamber which is the key component to Rhino's tame characteristics. The position of the barrel lowers the center of gravity and yields a centerline of the bore more in line with the shooter's arm allowing for the most natural "point ability" while engaging a target. This characteristic also drastically reduces both recoil and muzzle flip which insures subsequent shots to be on target faster than ever before. The reduction of the recoil allows for the use of ultra light alloys to be used in the construction of the Rhino minimizing any adverse effect. The flat sided cylinder design of the Rhino reduces the typical revolver profile allowing greater concealment. With choices from 2" to 6" barrel lengths and sight options, the Rhino is truly a multipurpose handgun capable of reliable defensive duty, scoring ten rings, and taking game. Featuring both double and single action characteristics, the single action is actuated by a hammer cocking device that engages the unexposed hammer to prepare to fire.

Colt's Sporter Target R6551 HBar version of the AR-15 is one of the most accurate versions of one of the most famous military weapons of all time. The HBars are incredibly accurate due to their 20" heavy barrels and the fact that they were hand-picked at the test range because they shot better groupings than the other Colt AR's. This rifle has all the original Colt packaging and comes with the original aluminum carrying case. Bundled in the case is all the factory packaging, including the original sling, all the original colt paperwork, original mags, and cleaning rods. title: For Sale:  NIB Franchi SPAS 12 (Special Purpose Automatic Shotgun) pre-ban model
postcontent:
Type: selective pump-action or gas-operated
Gauge: 12
Chamber: 2 3/4" (70 mm)
Length: 1041 mm
Barrel length: 546 mm.
Weight 4.4 kg
Capacity: 8 rounds in under barrel tube magazine
Manufactured from 1988-1990 for US import 


The SPAS-12 was designed by the Italian company Luigi Franchi Spa as a special purpose, military and police close combat weapon (actually, SPAS stands for Sporting Purpose Automatic Shotgun, or Special Purpose Automatic Shotgun, depending on the source). It featured a selective action for greater versatility, and can be used as a gas operated semi-automatic repeater or as a manually operated pump action repeater, depending on the mission and ammunition used. Since its introduction SPAS-12 became a very popular police and special-forces weapon, being versatile, reliable and with good firepower. On the other hand, it is heavier than most other similar shotguns and quite complicated, which results in relatively high prices.

SPAS-12 utilizes somewhat traditional for shotguns gas system with annular gas piston locating around the under barrel magazine tube. It operates the bolt with vertically tilting locking lug that engages the barrel extension to lock.SPAS-12 can be switched between gas operated self-loading mode and manually operated pump mode by pressing and holding a button at the bottom of the forearm and pulling the forearm slightly forward for AUTOMATIC mode or backward for PUMP(or MANUAL) mode. Earlier models of the SPAS-12 had the lever type safety at the front of the trigger guard, but due to some deficiencies this was latter replaced by the push-button (cross-bolt) safety at the same place. 

SPAS-12 could be fitted with stamped metallic butt-stock that folds to the top of the receiver when not in use, and with a pistol grip made of plastic. Alternatively, solid plastic butts-tocks with pistol grips are available. Barrel has cylinder bore with screw-on muzzle devices (cokes of flash hiders). Sights usually are of rifle type, with post front and open notch rear sight.

Additional Charges 
Must pay both FFL dealer charges and shipping cost if sold outside Wisconsin

postcontent:
Few were manufactured between 1983 to early 1989
This is the 41AE version and comes in hard plastic case and sleeve
Description 
Imported by Action Arms the Israeli Military Industries (IMI) Uzi was a revolutionary weapon in that it was the first to use a telescoping bolt design, in which the bolt wraps around the breech end of the barrel. This allows the barrel to be moved far back into the receiver and the magazine to be housed in the pistol grip. The Uzi uses an open bolt, blowback-operated design. The open bolt design exposes the breech end of the barrel, and improves cooling during periods of continuous fire. Used by the Secret Service from the 1960s until the 1990s, the Uzi is known as one of the most compact, yet versatile, personal defense weapons of the past forty years. This Uzi is a new in box pre-ban Model B in 41AE caliber. It's been stored and is in excellent condition. The gun pictured may have a different serial number, but is a NIB Uzi.

title: For Sale:  NIB pre-ban Action Arms Israeli Military Industries (IMI) Uzi Pistol 45 CP and 9mm conversion kits 9mm Extremely Rare
postcontent:
Few were manufactured between 1983 to early 1989
This is the 45CP version with a 9mm conversion and comes in a box with pistol in a hard plastic case, 9mm conversion kit and 1 box of 45CP bullets and 1 box of 9mm bullets
Description 
Imported by Action Arms the Israeli Military Industries (IMI) Uzi was a revolutionary weapon in that it was the first to use a telescoping bolt design, in which the bolt wraps around the breech end of the barrel. This allows the barrel to be moved far back into the receiver and the magazine to be housed in the pistol grip. The Uzi uses an open bolt, blowback-operated design. The open bolt design exposes the breech end of the barrel, and improves cooling during periods of continuous fire. Used by the Secret Service from the 1960s until the 1990s, the Uzi is known as one of the most compact, yet versatile, personal defense weapons of the past forty years. This Uzi is a new in box pre-ban Pistol Model in 9mm. It's been stored and is in excellent condition. The gun pictured may have a different serial number, but is a NIB Uzi. 
The UZI pistol was developed by Israel Military Industries (now IWI Ltd) during early 1980s from the famous Micro-UZI submachine gun. Intended users for the UZI pistol were various security agencies and services which wanted a high-capacity semi-automatic pistol, and civilian shooters (mostly in USA) which also wanted such gun with "cool Uzi style". Despite somewhat rough appearance UZI pistols were reliable and quite accurate. It also must be noted that 'original' UZI pistols should not be confused with full-size weapons based on semi-automatic only full-size Uzi carbines but without the shoulder stock. 
UZI pistol is blowback-operated semi-automatic weapon which fires from closed bolt. It has a stamped steel receiver and the bolt is fully enclosed inside. Bolt is of 'telescoped' design, that is, it is hollow in the front and encloses the rear part of the barrel when in battery. Uzi pistol has a single action trigger and utilizes an internal sliding striker (firing pin). Manual safety of sliding type, and is located above the grip on the left side of the gun. Magazines are of double stack design, interchangeable with other guns of Uzi family (in 9mm caliber). Sights are of open type, with flip-up rear sight, adjustable for windage.
Details:
• Semi-auto carbine
• 4.5" barrel
• Baked enamel black finish over phosphated (parkerized) base
• 25 round mag
• Original sling
• Original molded plastic and cardboard boxes
• Bayonet lug
• Includes case, cover sleeve, all original literature and accessories
Additional Charges 
Must pay both FFL dealer charges and shipping cost if sold outside Wisconsin or you wish to use FFL dealers

title: For Sale/Trade:  Vintage Colt SP-1 Carbine
postcontent:
Up for sale is a vintage Colt Sporter Carbine that dates late 1960s or early 1970s.  It's a slab side pre-ban carbine with a 16 inch barrel, 1 in 9 twist, and is in 90% condition or so.  Given the condition of the bolt and gas system, I'd estimate that this has seen less than 100 rounds through it.  The original stock, which is an aircraft grade high gloss aluminum, comes with it.  The previous owner swapped it out for a DPMS six position stock since the Colt original is only two positions.  The rifle itself is in great condition with little wear outside of a few minor cosmetic scratches here and there from handling.  

I'm looking for something a little more modern, so I'm selling this Vietnam era carbine.  I'd be willing to trade for a mid-range AR-15 like a DPMS, Delton, or Palmetto State Armory with cash on the side so I could purchase a decent optic.  I'm not after AKs, SKS, pump action shotguns, or anything of the ilk.  I'm only after AR-15s.  More importantly I'd prefer cash.  

You can check Gunbroker if you'd like, but I've seen this rifle selling for 1900 elsewhere in similar condition but I'm pricing it to sell.  Only serious offers considered, please contact via e-mail option in Armslist.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Insight Integrated Laser White Light Pointer
postcontent:
Manufacture: Insight Technologies
Model: LAM-100
Laser: Infrared (IR) Aiming Laser, Visible Aiming Laser
Light: Fixed Focus IR Illuminator and 100 Lumen Bulb
Power: Powered by Two 1.5V AA Batteries
Control: Toggle switch or remote
Mount: Mounts Glock style pistol rail, or Beretta 92 series

Originally designed in response to the U.S. Navy S.E.A.L.'s Assault Pistol program, the Laser Aiming Module, (L.A.M.) pioneered new ground and set the standard for multi-laser/white light capability in a compact pistol mounted package. Today, L-3 Insight Technology's LAM-1000 is known to the U.S. Military as the ILWLP. This Model will mount on all standard Glock Pistols.

Comes with plastic mounting device that attaches to Beretta 92 series pistol, so that you can add the ILWLP to your Beretta.

Check gun sales websites, amazon, or anywhere online for the insight ILWLP and they cost upward of 1,500-1,800.

Not only does it have a light and laser you can see, but it's got an IR light and laser that you can use along with a night vision device, but no one else would be able to see. Light up a room without anyone but you knowing!

Only selling it so cheap because I bought it for a deployment that fell through, and now I have no use for it. It has never been used. Cannot buy these as a regular civilian through the retailer. Only military/LE can buy them, but they are completely legal to own.

title: For Sale:  m35a2 - Deuce and a half! Immaculate condition. - $6500
postcontent:
1969 Military contract built m35a2 Deuce and a half for sale. 60,000ish miles (mileage is correct on the dash)

It is the White multifuel engine which means it will burn gas, diesel, oil, bio-diesel... etc.. basically everything combustible except for rocket and aviation fuel (says so on the dash). Engine is the LTD-465 MF. (amazing torque)

This is the most amazing specimen of this truck I've seen. It has fresh (as fresh as you can get in the civilian market) paint, which is bio-weapon resistant. It has a brand new tarp cover for the back and the engine and transmission were overhauled before it sold at DRMO. It is in immaculate condition.

I've personally driven this thing for a few thousand miles, and done the maintenance myself, which wasn't much.

The tires are BRAND NEW.

There are exactly two things wrong with this truck. I needs a new wind-shield wiper blade, and a new e-brake cable (any parts store has the cable, the wiper has to be ordered on line for $12)

Of course, when you put it into 10 wheel drive low, it's like a tank.

contact me through email, serious buyers only, and the price is pretty firm. Cash is king.

IR spotlight with hardware to attach to Binocular. 

I am open to all trades....Mostly HIGH END 1911's. AR15's. AK-47 or 74. ANYTHING COLT. S&W revolvers with emphasis on performance center models. Depending on what you have i may take or add cash. Tell me what you have!!!

Original box and Manual.

Softcase

extra battery

HERE ARE THE SPECS

Features:

-Easy access power button, the goggles turn on immediately with no warm up time.
-Object focus button for electronic forward and back focus control.
-Image brightness control.
-Auto off after 5 minutes of inactivity.
-Dual eye piece focus and side adjustment.
-According to the manual if you wear eye glasses they are not needed.
-Powered by a CR-P2 6V Lithium battery.
-Low power indicator when approximately 30 minutes of battery life remains.
-Includes hand strap, neck strap, eye piece\lens covers, instructions, and carry case.
-Automatic brightness control; auto adjustment to changing light levels.
-The unit is completely water proof and floats in water!!
-High light indicator warns when light levels are too high.
-The unit automatically shuts off after 7 seconds of high light conditions.
-Lens cover has a pin hole viewer for use\testing in daylight conditions.
-Auto image brightness protection to protect your eyes and intensifier components.

Official Product Description:

Night Vision: ITT Night Quest 260 Generation III Binocular 

ITT has been the world leader in night vision equipment development since their inception in 1959 and are now the sole supplier to the U.S. Military. Proven by U.S. and Allied Forces in Operation Desert Storm, ITT's Generation 3 night vision products are light years ahead of the surplus Russian equipment being pawned at army surplus stores. 404 precision engineered processes go into the assembly and manufacturing of each viewer. Several features set ITT's products apart from anything else on the market. These are: a state-of-the-art image intensifier tube with their unique MCP (microchannel plate) which contains over 6,000,000 microchannels. Each channel is 20 times smaller than the width of a human hair. Covering the microchannel plate is a thin protective film that's less than 100 atoms thick. The phosphor screen has a resolution 20 times higher than the typical television set, and all night vision products are sealed under clean-room conditions in such an ultra-high vacuum state that no other manufacturer can compare. The end result is clarity and resolution unmatched by others.
Night Quest 250/260

Compact, lightweight and weather resistant, the 250/260 binocular is a vital visual aid for peace of mind. These units were tested to rigid military specifications and were used in Desert Storm. Ideal for search and rescue, security and recreation, the Night Quest comes in both G2 and G3 Models. Superior clarity and resolution even in extremely low-light conditions allows the Model 250/260 to capture even the slightest speck of starlight to provide excellent night-time viewing. Ruggedly constructed, water resistant and lightweight (26 ounces), the Model 250/260 is easy to handle and has automatic gain control and electronic focus. The units feature F/1.4 optics and a 40° field of view. Runs on a 6V lithium camera battery.

title: For Sale/Trade:  91/59 Mosin Nagant Carbine UNISSUED $250 OBO
postcontent:
Up for sale or trade is a Mosin Nagant 91/59 Carbine Unissued. This rifle is in excellent condition fired only a few times by myself. It was restocked, refinished, and set up for post cold war era Russia in 1959 by their Arsenal. It was thought that these were refurbished for internal Police and Government security use in the 1960's. This rifle shows no service use and came to me packaged for long term storage, cosmoline packed with no visable usage since refurbishment. I believe all the numbers match and it is an 1943 Izzy 91/30 converted to 91/59. It is near perfect condition and very difficult to find these 91/59 version carbines in this condition. It comes slinged and shoots very nice, I am very schooled in Mosin Nagants and will sell or trade this fine firearm for the right deal. M44's and 91/59 are not being imported anymore, buy one now while the prices are reasonable. This rifle comes with ammo. 7.62 x 54R, one box.

$250 OBO CASH AND YOU OWN IT: Note this is not a beat up 91/30 or M91 it is a refubished Russian arsenal 91/59 and if you think I will sell it for cheap dont message me. These sell in USED condition for $250 to $350 on Gunbroker, this is unissued and I am selling low at $250 already, lowest I will go is $225 cash, take it or leave it, as I do not have to sell it and am not hard up for money... I am not trying to be rude but I know what it is worth and the condition it is in. Some people think all Mosin's are $99 dollar guns and they are not! Thank you
